ICriteria<T> Interface

Summary

ICriteria<T> is a simplified API for retrieving entities by composing ICriterion objects. This is a very convenient approach for functionality like "search" screens where there is a variable number of conditions to be placed upon the result set. The Spring.Persistence.Core.Session|TSession is a factory for ICriteria<T> . ICriterion instances are usually obtained via the factory methods on Spring.Persistence.Criteria.Restrictions|Restrictions .

Namespace: Spring.Persistence.Criteria.Interfaces

Methods
Show:
 NameDescription
Add(ICriterion)

Add a restriction to constrain the results to be retrieved.

Clear

Clear current Criteria.

OrderBy(IOrderBy)

Add an ordering to the result set.

Page(Integer,Integer)

Returns the results in pages.

ToList

Returns the results.

Where(ICriterion)

Add a restriction to constrain the results to be retrieved.

Top
Examples

Delphi
var
  cats: IList<TCat>;
begin
  cats := session.CreateCriteria<TCat>
    .Add(Restrictions.Like('name', 'Iz%'))
    .Add(Restrictions.Gt('weight', MIN_WEIGHT))
    .OrderBy(TOrder.Asc('age')).ToList;
Delphi
var
  cats: IList<TCat>;
  Weight, Age: Prop;
begin
  Weight := GetProp('Weight');
  Age := GetProp('Age');
  cats := session.FindWhere<TCat>    (Weight > MIN_WEIGHT)
.OrderBy(Age.Desc).ToList;
